Qualifiers.Scope: Defines a type of structure, the 'Roofed porch', as illustrated in Figure 4.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Roofed entry way (vaulted or not), Combination porch & vaulted entry way.

Constants.Procedures: The method for measuring the height of porches is specified elsewhere.

Conditions.Mandatory: No specific constraints are listed on this page for this type.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This is type 'A' within the classification 'Types of porches and entry ways' (Figure 4).
Relationships.Cross-references: See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13.

extracted_rules.rule: Roofed Entry Way (not vaulted) Height Regulation

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulates the maximum height of non-vaulted roofed entryways.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Structures classified as 'B Roofed entry way (not vaulted)'.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Vaulted entryways, Combination porch & vaulted entry way.

Constants.Procedures: The method for measuring height is specified elsewhere.

Conditions.Mandatory: The height of the structure must be less than 12 feet above grade.
Conditions.Dependencies: Applies only if the structure is a 'Roofed entry way (not vaulted)'.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This is type 'B' within the classification 'Types of porches and entry ways' (Figure 4).
Relationships.Cross-references: See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13.
Relationships.Logical dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with rules for structures where height must be greater than 12'.

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulates the minimum height of vaulted entryways.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Structures classified as 'C Vaulted entry way'.

Constants.Procedures: The method for measuring height is specified elsewhere.

Conditions.Mandatory: The height of the structure must be greater than 12 feet above grade.
Conditions.Dependencies: Applies only if the structure is a 'Vaulted entry way'.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This is type 'C' within the classification 'Types of porches and entry ways' (Figure 4).
Relationships.Cross-references: See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13.
Relationships.Logical dependencies: This rule is mutually exclusive with rules for structures where height must be less than 12'.

extracted_rules.rule: Combination Porch & Vaulted Entry Way Height Regulation

Qualifiers.Scope: Regulates the minimum height of combination porch and vaulted entryway structures.
Qualifiers.Applicability: Structures classified as 'D Combination porch & vaulted entry way'.
Qualifiers.Exclusions: Structures that are not a combination of a porch and a vaulted entryway.

Constants.Procedures: The method for measuring height is specified elsewhere.

Conditions.Mandatory: The height of the structure must be greater than 12 feet above grade.
Conditions.Dependencies: Applies only if the structure is a 'Combination porch & vaulted entry way'.

Relationships.Hierarchical: This is type 'D' within the classification 'Types of porches and entry ways' (Figure 4).
Relationships.Cross-references: See how to measure height of porches & entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13.
Relationships.Logical dependencies: Shares the same height condition as the 'Vaulted entry way' rule (Type C).
